DOC.brief_summary: The objectives of this study are to evaluate the effectiveness of an antiperspirant in preventing or attenuating the severity of palmer-plantar erythrodysesthesia associated with the Food and Drug Administration (FDA)-approved doses of capecitabine. The hypothesis is that cytotoxic compounds in sweat will be prevented from being deposited in the skin and causing chronic toxicity.
DOC.criteria: Has not previously received a regimen that includes 5fluorouracil > 18 years old No known allergy or intolerance to Ban Unscented RollOn Antiperspirant < 18 years of age
